item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. How much memory do you need in 2024 to run 1M concurrent tasks? (66 points | 29 comments)
2. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (479 points | 93 comments)
3. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (273 points | 26 comments)
4. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser–No Downloads, No Registrations (37 points | 7 comments)
5. BYD launches sodium-ion grid-scale BESS product (7 points | 1 comment)
6. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (154 points | 31 comments)
7. Microbenchmarks Are Experiments (13 points | 1 comment)
8. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (212 points | 105 comments)
9. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (166 points | 55 comments)
10. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (36 points | 4 comments)
11. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (72 points | 25 comments)
12. US Antitrust Watchdog Launches Broad Microsoft Investigation (5 points | discuss)
13. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (18 points | discuss)
14. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (114 points | 46 comments)
15. Car tires shed a quarter of all microplastics in the environment (153 points | 141 comments)
16. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (21 points | 7 comments)
17. Australian Parliament bans social media for under-16s with world-first law (2 points | discuss)
18. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (95 points | 10 comments)
19. Float Self-Tagging (31 points | 41 comments)
20. Canada Competition Bureau sues Google for anti-competitive conduct in online ads (45 points | 15 comments)
21. Multimodal Interpretability in 2024 (3 points | discuss)
22. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (86 points | 82 comments)
23. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (320 points | 233 comments)
24. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (285 points | 515 comments)
25. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (271 points | 214 comments)
26. The great abandonment: what happens to the natural world when people disappear? (53 points | 53 comments)
27. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (12 points | discuss)
28. Show HN: Myphotos.site – Make a gallery website from Google Photos (157 points | 70 comments)
29. Spotify has shut down several API endpoints (179 points | 136 comments)
30. Aftershock II (13 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
